quote.body: I don't ask for money. I don't ask for sexual favors. I don't ask for access to the hardware you design and sell. I just ask for the thing I gave you: source code that I can use myself.

The root problem with conventional currency is all the trust that's required to make it work. The central bank must be trusted not to debase the currency, but the history of fiat currencies is full of breaches of that trust. Banks must be trusted to
quote.work: Bitcoin open source implementation of P2P currency

quote.body: hold our money and transfer it electronically, but they lend it out in waves of credit bubbles with barely a fraction in reserve. We have to trust them with our privacy, trust them not to let identity thieves drain our accounts.
quote.work: Bitcoin open source implementation of P2P currency

quote.body: If you don't believe it or don't get it, I don't have the time to try to convince you, sorry.
